intro: Clitandra schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African white wood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, followed by woody capsules containing elliptical seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
